description: 1951 Chevrolet 3100 Half-ton Pickup Truck
Upgraded 350 CID V-8 engine power plant
Turbo Hydramatic 350 three-speed automatic transmission
Swift Red exterior and red interior
Power steering and new exhaust
Air bag suspension
New tires, dual wood side rails for the bed and white, vented rally wheels

MotoeXotica Classic Cars is pleased to present yet another Advance Design Pickup Truck – this 1951 3100 half-ton model. Built in April 1951 at GM's Leeds Assembly in Kansas City, Missouri, this example is finished in Swift Red with an upgraded drive train & suspension.

The truck's paint and trim are in overall great condition while the glass panels, including the split windshield, are clear and intact. The truck's lights are haze-free and intact while the truck's bodywork is straight and solid. The engine bay is very tidy, the battery looks new and the cargo area, with its wood bed floor and dual wood side rails, is in excellent condition. The truck's bumpers are very presentable with some minor imperfections, most notable on the right front fender.

Under the hood, a 350 CID V-8 engine replaced the original 216 engine. The V-8 is mated to a Turbo Hydramatic 350 three-speed automatic transmission. Driver convenience features include power steering and an air bag suspension.  This truck drives out with plenty of power with a smooth ride.
This half-ton rolls on Fuzion radials, size 205/75R15 at all four corners, and they are in very good condition. Each tire surrounds recently added white, vented rally wheels.

Inside, the red bench seat is in excellent order. There's no carpet but the black floor mats are in great condition. The headliner and three-spoke steering wheel are in decent shape, too. The red metal instrument panel is in very good condition while the inner door panels are in satisfactory shape and horn is inop. Even the shifter still looks good. Finishing the interior is a Custom Sound AM/FM stereo.

Advance Design was a truck series by Chevrolet, their first major redesign after WWII. It was billed as a larger, stronger, and sleeker design in comparison to the earlier AK Series. First available on Saturday June 28, 1947, these trucks were sold with various minor changes over the years.

The same basic design family was used for all of its trucks including the Suburban, panel trucks, canopy express and cab overs. The cab overs used the same basic cab configuration and similar grille but used a shorter and taller hood and different fenders. The unique Cab Over fenders and hood required a custom cowl area which makes the Cab Over Engine cabs and normal truck cabs incompatible with one another while all truck cabs of all weights interchange.

For 1951, doors had vent windows. Mid-year change from a nine-board bed to eight boards per bed. It was the last year for 80-mph speedometer, chrome window handle knobs and chrome wiper knob. There were new serial number codes: JP ½ ton, JR ¾ ton and JS 1 ton. Front brake linings were larger and bonded instead of riveted. There was an improved foot-operated parking brake with the pedal near the driver's left foot and a simple release mechanism on all models.
From 1947 until 1955, Chevrolet trucks were number one in sales in the United States, with rebranded versions sold at GMC locations.

While General Motors used this front-end sheet metal, and to a slightly lesser extent the cab, on all of its trucks except for the Cab Overs, there are three main sizes of this truck: the half-, three-quarter- and full ton capacities in short and long wheelbase.

This truck is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows 16,493 miles. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear, mileage exempt title. GET OUT AND DRIVE!!!

Bright chrome, windshield sun visor, tall whitewalls, patina, and that great art deco color make this 1950 Chevrolet 3100 seem like the perfect time capsule.  But when you notice lowered suspension and hear the sound of the V8, you realize this classy pickup is also custom cruiser.

This Chevy just gets cooler the longer you look at it.  That's because it features just the right amount of patina to make people take notice.  It might have the look of worn-in, but there was a solid investment in getting this to look like a barn find.  You know that immediately as you inspect the quality of the bright turquoise paint and how everything is smooth over the Chevy's famously rounded fenders.  Plus, this tall truck has a huge silver chrome streak, with pieces like its wraparound bumper and legendary five-bar grille that stand out like a pristine art deco skyscraper.  There's even plenty of brightwork complementing the real wood truck bed.  And while this one has a great vintage appearance, this one also gives plenty of hints that it's a custom build.  After all, while you might be admiring those color matched steelie wheels with whitewalls, you also can't help but notice they tuck under the body for a lowered, more aggressive stance.

Inside, the turquoise returns on all the metal parts, but it's now joined by some terrific brown vinyl on the bench seat and door panels.  And with carpeting that has matching tan piping, this is truly a premium presentation.  But that hint of barn find attitude is still present on the interior, too, for those who really look for it – anyone else spot the pre-war Ford steering wheel?  Beyond that is a full set of Dolphin gauges, which is another clue to the performance upgrade in this patina pickup.

The standard Thriftmaster six-cylinder engine that came with this Chevy 3100 would never do in a truck this cool.  Instead, it was upgraded to iconic small block power with a 350 cubic-inch V8.  It looks just as ready to show off as the rest of the truck with the shiny ribbed valve covers and air topper.  And even some of the brightwork is part of the mechanical enhancements, too, like the pulleys and aluminum radiator.  And we know you love how the block was painted to match the rest of the truck's turquoise.  But more than just look great, this is a powerful package with a Holley Four-barrel carburetor and Weiand intake.  There's also a lot of comfort in this classic, including a TH400 three-speed automatic transmission and power steering.  Plus, the front end is a far more modern setup with an independent suspension that features sway bar front disc brakes.

A terrific all-around presentation with all the right upgrades makes for an iconic classic with plenty of modern appeal.  A turn-key package like this is so irresistible, you know you need to hurry to grab this Chevy.  Call today!!!

GR Auto Gallery is pleased to present this This '56 Chevy 3100 sporting classic pickup style with the performance help of modern technological advantages. It shows well with fantastic chrome accenting the dark purple paint. It's powered by a new SBC 350 CID V8 engine mated with a Turbo 350 automatic transmission. It also features working air conditioning, power steering, power brakes and wide white wall tires accenting the wheels. The SBC has an Edelbrock Manifold and Carb to help it breath and deliver fuel and dual flowmaster exhaust, Pioneer stereo and more! This is a really well-done truck in a very desirable body style!

Beginning in 1955, Chevrolet's new 'Task Force' series of trucks was quite a departure from their existing line of pickups. Smooth, rounded sheet-metal replaced the old-style fenders, and large, wrap-around windshield glass offered better visibility and a more contemporary look. 1957 began the third-year for Task Force pickups and received a distinctive new grille that would be a one-year feature only! This truck is not going to last, please call or email for more details!

We are offering a fully restored Chevrolet 3100 that offers no excuses and sits low. This truck was completely redone just a few years ago using all top brand components; the body is sound and the paint is free of any major imperfections. It will definitely stand out in a crowd, as it is a head turner. It drives GREAT and is tastefully lowered 6'' and sits on 15'' AMERICAN RACING wheels wrapped in FUTURA super sport tires. It is powered by a STRONG V8 with a mild cam and other nice mods that is mated to a 3 speed automatic TH350 transmission.

This BEAUTIFUL truck has undergone extensive bodywork that includes a professionally chopped top, molded headlights, flush mount door handles, de-badging, extensive smoothing, custom roll pan with integrated tail lights, and all new wood in the bed with a flush mount gas cap.

When you come down to look at it, - and trust us... you WILL want to come check it out - some noteworthy things that you might miss include: upgraded disc brakes, power steering, power brakes, an aluminum radiator, and an upgraded intake.

The interior was tastefully done and beautifully executed by sticking to the red and black color scheme of the truck. The dash is a gorgeous gloss black that is accented by the custom red fabric on the door panels and carpet. You will notice the black leather racing inspired seats with red stitching and a custom secret compartment with a sliding door behind them. Everything in the truck is awesome and works well together, but needs to be seen in person to be fully appreciated.

Up for sale we have a 1954 Chevy 3100 Rat Rod Pick Up.  This pick up has the old look paired with the newer power train.  In the paragraphs to follow we will give a brief description of the exterior, interior, and heartbeat of the Chevy, but first we would like to tell you a little about us.

Smoky Mountain Traders is a classic car dealer in east Tennessee. We are family owned, operated, and own our entire inventory, no consignments, and only deal in muscle cars and vintage auto. You can count on us to have 70 to 80 cars at all times. We don't have a big show room that our customers would otherwise pay for. So, that's how we can sell for less than other dealers. To contact us for more information, pictures, or any questions call our office at (865)988-8088 or visit our SmokyMountainTraders website.

We will start off with the exterior of the 3100.  The body is straight, but with that being said it does have some rust to give it the look of an old barn find.  It has lettering for detail to make it look like an older service truck.  When this truck was done they replaced the bed floor with all new wood and stainless strips.  It also appears to have had new seals installed around the glass.  The chrome grill shows age as does the bumpers.  The wheels on this pick up is a set of Gray Finish Coys with 18's up front and 20's in the rear with new tires.

Next, we will take a look at the interior of the Pick Up.  On the inside it has all been redone.  The seat has been recovered in the correct style vinyl.  Also new carpet and a headliner board was installed.  When you look at the dash they replaced the steering column with a brushed aluminum tilt and added a Banjo Wheel.  The factory style gauges were left and they added a set of Pro comp under dash gauges and a tach.  A short console was installed and it houses the Lokar Shifter.

Finally, we will take a look at heartbeat of the Chevy.  Under the hood the firewall and inner fenders look like the body.  But the power comes from a late model fuel injected 4.8/5.3 Engine that's mated to a 350 Turbo Trans and a 10 Bolt Rear End.  The frame under this Truck is from an S10 with Four Wheel Disc Brakes that are Power along with Power Steering.  The fuel system has been replaced with an Aluminum tank with new lines and pump.

If we can help you in any way with questions or a specific picture, you can call our office at (865)988-8088. Or feel free to call Daniel at (423) 807 0600, Devvin at (865) 256 2366, or you can e-mail us at
[Email Dealer]

1950 Chevrolet 3100 5-window Half-ton Pickup
116-inch wheelbase
350 CID SBC V-8 engine
Turbo Hydramatic 350 three-speed automatic transmission
Silver over black paint with green accent stripe
Black and brown custom interior
Grant steering wheel, Omega instrumentation

Classic pickup fans, come by MotoeXotica Classic Cars and check out one of our newest acquisitions, a 1950 Chevrolet five-window half-ton pickup truck. This particular example was made in GM's Norwood, Ohio factory.

Finished in silver over black, this truck's paint and trim are in overall very good condition. The truck's windows are in overall good shape, including the curved “Nu-Vue” rear corner windows, but there are a few blemishes visible and the truck has no windshield wipers. The truck's lights, including the hooded, custom headlights and taillights, are in great condition. The truck's bodywork is straight and solid, including the cargo bed with its wood floor and green trim. The full-width, black sun visor adds an element of style to the truck's appearance. The black painted bumpers look great, especially in contrast to the chrome grille and bumper guards. The engine bay is tidy and the battery appears new.

With its 116-inch wheelbase, this truck rolls on blackwall radial tires, size 235/60R15 in front and 255/60R15 in back. Each tire surrounds a five-spoke Rev alloy wheel. The wheels are in very good order while the tires are in satisfactory condition.

Inside that engine bay is understood to be a 350 CID small block Chevrolet V-8 engine with a Performance RPM intake manifold and a Summit Racing air cleaner housing and filter. It breathes via dual exhausts that exit beneath the running boards. Backing up this engine is a Turbo Hydramatic 350 three-speed automatic transmission. This engine replaces the original 216 CID inline six-cylinder that was installed at the factory.

This truck sports a custom interior. The black and brown bucket seats with a center console are in great shape while the black carpet and matching headliner are in satisfactory condition. A three-spoke Grant steering wheel looks fantastic while the instrument panel houses a full array of Omega Classic Instruments. The inner door panels are in satisfactory condition while the dash is in overall good order. As a touch of whimsy, a green skull tops the shifter.

Lever-action shocks are replaced by modern tubular shocks. This is the last year for the driver-side vent. Handle for side cowl vent is flat steel, not maroon plastic as it was previously. Wiper knob is chrome plated steel.  Speedometer/odometer and horn are inoperable.
This car is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows xx,xxx miles. It is sold as is, where is on a clean and clear, mileage exempt title.

1953 Chevrolet 3100 Half-ton Pickup
Same owner for past 31 years!
Fresh restoration; truck reportedly driven 600 miles since being restored
Final year for the two-piece windshield and rectangular taillights
216 CID inline six-cylinder engine
Three-speed manual transmission with synchromesh
Mariner Blue exterior (code 417) with yellow pinstriping
Wood bed siderails and new wooden bed floor
Wide whitewall tires
Driver's side spotlight and cab sunvisor
Documentation includes original Chevrolet Truck Shop Manual and a copy of Jim Carter Antique Truck Parts catalog from Fall 1995

Those looking for postwar pickups should stop by MotoeXotica Classic Cars; we are proud to present this 1953 Chevrolet 3100 Half-ton “Light Delivery” model.  The title on this tidy truck shows the same loving owner since 1987, 31 years!

Finished in Mariner Blue with a yellow pinstripe, this truck's paint and trim are in very good order but not show quality, with only the slightest blemishes visible on close examination. The truck's split windshield and other glass panels are clear and intact. Its lights, including the driver's side spotlight, look great and the truck's bodywork is straight and solid. The bumpers are shiny and fit well to the body and there's even an external sunvisor for driver and passenger. The cargo bed has a newer wooden floor and corresponding bed siderails. This 3100 rolls bias-ply wide whitewalls, size 6.70-15 at all four corners, each one surrounding a steel wheel with a full moon factory wheel cover.
Under the hood is a 216 CID straight six-cylinder engine mated to a three-speed manual transmission with synchromesh.

Inside, the bench seat is in great shape. The headliner and three-spoke steering wheel with rim cover are both in satisfactory condition. The instrument panel and inner door panels are in good order, as is the shift lever. Completing the truck's interior is a factory AM radio.

Advance-Design was a truck series by Chevrolet, its first major redesign after WWII. It was billed as a larger, stronger, and sleeker design in comparison to the earlier AK Series. First available on Saturday June 28, 1947, these trucks were sold with various minor changes over the years until March 25, 1955, when the Task Force Series trucks replaced the aging Advance-Design model.

The same basic design family was used for all of its trucks including the Suburban, panel trucks, canopy express and cab overs. The cab overs used the same basic cab configuration and similar grille but used a shorter and taller hood and different fenders. The unique Cab Over fenders and hood required a custom cowl area which makes the Cab Over Engine cabs and normal truck cabs incompatible with one another while all truck cabs of all weights interchange.
From 1947 until 1955, Chevrolet trucks were number one in sales in the United States, with rebranded versions sold at GMC locations.

While General Motors used this front-end sheet metal, and to a slightly lesser extent the cab, on all of its trucks except for the Cab Overs, there are three main sizes of this truck: the half-, three-quarter-, and full ton capacities in short and long wheelbase.

Nineteen fifty-three was the last year for the 216 CID inline-six. Hood side emblems now only read 3100, 3600, 3800, 4400, or 6400 in large print. New serial number codes: H ½ ton, J ¾ ton and L 1 ton.
Competition to this Chevrolet truck in 1953 included Dodge's B-series half-ton trucks, Ford's F-100 trucks and GMC's New Design trucks.

This truck is currently located at our facility in St. Louis, Missouri. Current mileage on the odometer shows 43,607 miles. Former owner reports truck has been driven about 600 miles since restored. It is sold as is, where is, on a clean and clear, mileage exempt title. GET OUT AND DRIVE!!!
